gurmukhi: ਖਲੇ ਰਾਮਚੰਦ ਹੁਤੇ ਜਹਾਂ || ਭਟ ਭਾਜ ਭੱਗ ਲਗੇ ਤਹਾਂ ||੭੭੧||
transliteration: Khale Raamchannd Houte Jahaan|| Bhat Bhaaj Bhagg Lage Tahaan||771||
translation: Te warriors reached the place where Ram was standing.771.

gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਜਾੲਿ ਬਾਤ ਕਹੀ ੳੁਨੈ || ਬਹੁ ਭਾਂਤ ਸੋਕ ਦਯੋ ਤਿਨੈ ||
transliteration: Jab Jaae Baat Kahiounai|| Bahu Bhaant Kok Dayo Tinai||
translation: When all the events were related to him, he was in great anguish;

gurmukhi: ਸੁਨ ਬੈਨ ਮੋਨ ਰਹੈ ਬਲੀ || ਜਨ ਚਿੱਤ੍ਰ ਪਾਹਨ ਕੀ ਖਲੀ ੭੭੨ ||
transliteration: Soun Bain Mon Rahai Balee|| Jan Chittra Paahan Kikhalee||772||
translation: Hearing their word the mighty sovereign remained silent like a portrait, becoming like a stone-slab.772.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਨ ਬੈਠ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਬਿਚਾਰਯੋ || ਤੁਮ ਜਾਹੁ ਭਰਥ ੳੁਚਾਰਯੋ ||
transliteration: Poun Baith Mantra Bichdaryo|| Toum Jaahu Bharath Ouchdaryo||
translation: Then sitting down, he held consultations and addressing Bharat, he asked him to go, saying,

gurmukhi: ਮੁਨ ਬਾਲ ਦ੍ਵੈ ਜਿਨ ਮਾਰੀਯੋ || ਧਰਿ ਅਾਨ ਮੋਹਿ ਦਿਖਾਰੀਯੋ ||੭੭੩||
transliteration: Mounndbaal Dvai Jin Mdareeyo|| Dhar(i) Aan Mohe Dikhdareeyo||773||
translation: “Do not kill the boys of the sages, but bring them and show them to me.”773.

gurmukhi: ਸਜ ਸੈਨ ਭਰਥ ਚਲੇ ਤਹਾਂ || ਰਣ ਬਾਲ ਬੀਰ ਮੰਡੇ ਜਹਾਂ ||
transliteration: Saj Sain Bharath Chale Tahaan|| Ran Baal Beer Mande Jahaan||
translation: Bharat decorating his army marched to the place where the boys were standing ready (for war);

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁ ਭਾਤ ਬੀਰ ਸੰਘਾਰਹੀ || ਸਰ ਓਘ ਪ੍ਰਓਘ ਪ੍ਹਾਰਹੀ ||੭੭੪||
transliteration: Bahu Bhaat Beer Sanhar-hee|| Sar Ogh Pra-ogh Prahaar-hee||774||
translation: They were ready to kill the warriors by striking blows with many types of arrows.774.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਗ੍ਰੀਵ ਅੌਰ ਭਭੀਛਨੰ || ਹਨਵੰਤ ਅੰਗਦ ਰੀਛਨੰ ||
transliteration: Sougreev Aout Bhabheechhanan|| Hanvant Anad Reechhanan||
translation: Alongwith Sugriva, Vibhishan, Hanuman, Angad, Jambvant,

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਸੈਨ ਬਨਾੲਿਕੈ || ਤਿਨ ਪੈ ਚਲਯੋ ਸਮੁਹਾੲਿਕੈ ||੭੭੫||
transliteration: Bahu Bhaant(i) Sain Banaae-kai|| Tin Pai Chadyo Samuhaae-kai||775
translation: And with their various types of forces, Bharat went forward towards the brave boys.775.

gurmukhi: ਰਣ ਭੁਮ ਭਰਥ ਗੲੇ ਜਬੈ || ਮੁਨ ਬਾਲ ਦੋੲਿ ਲਖੇ ਤਬੈ ||
transliteration: Ran Bhoom Bharath Gad Jabai|| Mounndbaal Doe Lakhe Tabai||
translation: When Bharat reached the battlefield, he saw both the boys of sages;

gurmukhi: ਦੁੲਿ ਕਾਕ ਪੱਛਾ ਸੋਭਹੀ || ਲਖ ਦੇਵ ਦਾਨੋ ਲੋਭਹੀ ||੭੭੬||
transliteration: Due Kaak Pachchhaadsobh-hee|| Lakh Dev Daano Lobh-hee||776||
translation: Both boys looked impressive and both the gods and demons were allured on seeing them.776.
Speech of Bharat addressed to Lava :

gurmukhi: ਮੁਨ ਬਾਲ ਛਾਡਹੁ ਗਰਬ || ਮਿਲਿ ਅਾਨ ਮੋਹੂ ਸਰਬ ||
transliteration: Mounndbaal Chhaadoh Gadab|| Mil(i) Aan Mohoo Sarab||
translation: “O boys of the sages ! forsake your pride, come and meet me;
